actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

actions.committee: Committee on the Judiciary for its consideration of those provisions concerning Title II of the United States Code, for a period not to exceed 14 calendar days
actions.text: Ordered, that when reported, the bill be referred to the Committee on the Judiciary for its consideration of those provisions concerning Title II of the United States Code, for a period not to exceed 14 calendar days.
Subcommittee on Merchant Marine. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 99-748.

official_title: A bill to preserve rights of certain parties with an interest in certain vessels or fishing facilities, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends Federal bankruptcy provisions to extend partial immunity from an automatic stay or a court injunction of foreclosure, possession, or disposition proceedings to: (1) creditors with preferred ship mortgages or mortgages on certain fishery facilities; and (2) lessors or conditional vendors of vessels as defined in the Merchant Marine Act of 1936. Requires full payment in cash of all sums owed, plus applicable interest, to cure a default on preferred mortgages, mortgages, security agreements, leases, or conditional sales contracts on certain vessels.

titles.title: A bill to preserve rights of certain parties with an interest in certain vessels or fishing facilities, and for other purposes.
